importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Colombia recalled its ambassador to the U.S. for consultations, marking a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions between the two nations.
The date when the U.S. recalled its ambassador to Colombia in July, following claims by President Petro that the U.S. supported a plot to remove him from power.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This period highlights a recurring diplomatic crisis between Colombia and the U.S., with multiple rounds of ambassadorial recall and accusations of mutual interference in political affairs.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, signaling a major diplomatic rupture.
The action follows U.S. accusations that President Gustavo Petro is an 'illegal drug leader' and threatens to cut financial aid and raise tariffs on Colombian goods.
The U.S. has launched missile attacks on seven vessels it claims were drug-smuggling, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including some alleged to be Colombian citizens.
Colombia alleges that the U.S. operations target Colombian nationals and constitute acts of state violence, with the Colombian government accusing the U.S. of 'murder'.
This is the second time Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington in 2025, following a similar incident in July.
The U.S. has previously denied allegations that it supported a plot to remove President Petro from power, calling them 'baseless'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, following escalating tensions over drug trafficking, U.S. military actions targeting vessels allegedly involved in smuggling, and accusations that the U.S. supported a political plot to remove President Gustavo Petro from power. This marks the second such diplomatic move in 2025, with the U.S. having previously recalled its ambassador to Bogotá in July. The conflict intensified after President Donald Trump accused Petro of being a drug trafficker and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian exports, while U.S. warships launched missile attacks on seven vessels, killing at least 30 people, including some alleged to be Colombian citizens. Colombia claims these operations amount to state violence and murder, accusing the U.S. of targeting its nationals and undermining bilateral relations.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
